website_summaries.verdict: This model is more powerful than most, and the camouflage color of the saw looks great. However, our favorite feature is the adjustable angle of the saw, making it a good option for users who need to cut in tighter spaces than normal.
pros: The 8 amp motor cuts soft limbs up to 7.5 inches thick, a little less for harder limbs
For users who like to do their yard work with a little style, this model comes in an attractive camouflage color

This model stands out for its adjustable saw, which allows users to place the saw at any angle while the pole is extended, providing them access to areas that would be difficult for other saws to reach
cons: The 7.2-foot reach of the telescoping pole is shorter than most models, so it may not fit the needs of users with taller trees

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pole saw
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw is awesome! I live in South Florida and have many palm trees. I got estimates to trim them and they wanted $50/tree. I got this pole saw and a ladder and trimmed them with easy. The saw gets a bit warm but I give it a few minutes between fronds and I didn't have any issues. This saw has paid for itself in the first 10 min of use. I like that the blade articulates, makes cutting much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jose I Miceli

customer_reviews.title: amazon sell Returned products as NEW?
customer_reviews.text: amazon sell Returned products as NEW? I just opened the box today. I found that the saw was used. The box is brown, too. I paid the FULL price for a BRAND NEW saw. I feel awful!
customer_reviews.author: goog

customer_reviews.title: Was very pleased with how easy it was to cut up these ...
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as portable as my Ryobi 18v, but faster and more powerful for jobs close to the house. Was very pleased with how easy it was to cut up these 10-11" diameter logs.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan N.

customer_reviews.title: Kind of thought these were toys, or something for 'grandma' to use, but I was pleasantly surpised- powerful, fast, and USEFUL!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly powerful and useful for an electric saw. I've run chainsaws my whole life so it's not like I know nothing about real chainsaws...but I originally thought these were kind of a gimmick, or something for 'grandma' to use, kind of like an electric snowblower or something. My dad bought one and I used it at his place and was very pleasantly surprised. Ended up buying the same one, the Sun Joe 8amp, but in green. These saws rock! Highly recommended if you have lots of tree limbs within an extension cord distance from your house.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: I just got my order today (2/1/17) and it was reconditione
customer_reviews.text: I just got my order today (2/1/17) and it was reconditioned; incluring a printed packet from 'HOME AND POWER COMPANY" ...WTF.....IF i WANTED A USED ITEM, i WOULD HAVE BOUGHT ONE... SOmeone tell me what is going on. I noticed the same complaint for someone else two days ago. Explain or get ready for a return.
customer_reviews.author: M Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Not new but rebuilt.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing in the descriptions states it is rebuilt. The box has a label as new. Inside the box was a letter stating it was reconditioned by Home Innovations. I would have payed the extra $20 for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Merrill R. Mcalister

customer_reviews.title: Having grown up with gas saws - I had no idea these would work as well as they do.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for clearing the dead wood from around the house. Here in the Southwest US trees don't really get to be so thick so 10" is perfect for anything on my property. Just add 100' extension cord. I do have a couple suggestions though. This saw comes with oil, buy more. It's a small bottle to get you started but it's automatic lubing and at the end of a long day you'll have used most of the bottle. Also, watch the chain tension. The first day I needed to adjust the blade about 6 times. Now it's stretched and I can use it an entire day and not adjust it.
customer_reviews.author: obeychad

customer_reviews.title: Cannot cut anything
customer_reviews.text: I should have tested upon receiving it. Last night for the first time, assembled it, oiled and gave it a try. It doesn't cut at all. The chain was installed correctly. I tried on few different branches. My hand saw cut better. I'm very unhappy about this item. Few review says the saw is dull. I expect receiving product ready to be used with optimal condition. Highly disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Moo

customer_reviews.title: Broke 30 minutes into first use
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I have to say that this is a very powerful poll saw. It easily cut through branches. The saw is a bit heavy but powerful. However, after about 30 minutes of use, the tensioning screw vibrated loose and got lost. Had to call the company to get a new one. I'm still waiting on that item to get the saw working. So, a powerful saw that is somewhat poorly designed. If you get one, make sure you check that the tensioning screw is always tight. At least every 10 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jj

customer_reviews.title: Top heavy, hard to use, came defective missing part
customer_reviews.text: I received the product with missing oil cap and it’s super top heavy and dangerous to use. One of my friends fell off the latter and fractured 5 ribs while using this. I can’t return it now but it’s not a good product if you are reaching for high branches. I wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Chang

customer_reviews.title: Wimpy
customer_reviews.text: The product can barely cut through a wet paper bag. Used it on some lower Crepe Murtle branches that were about 2 inches thick. It took five minutes to cut through half a branch. I finished the job with a tree saw in 4 strokes and 1 minute. I can’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sallyo

customer_reviews.title: This is refurbished NOT a new unit.
customer_reviews.text: This is sold as being new, but I received a reconditioned unit. In large letters on the photocopiers manual it says "Do not return to the manufacturer." I sent it back asking for a replacement and got another refurb. I don't know who the fraudster is, but two fakes out of two tries is enough. I'm giving up and heading to Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit with a design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out the design law and corrected it I have had not problems with the saw The problem lies in the tension adjustment mechanism and simply requires a back-up nut or spacer to keep the tensioning rod from flexing up and down, causing the pin to slip out of it hole in the chain bar plate and kicking the chain off. I used a piece of a tie-wrap, which I placed into the channel where the tensioning rod lives and eliminated its up and down movement and my cheap little pole saw now works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Elderly Texan

customer_reviews.title: Durable products and good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Product did a great job at first but then the blade was full after cutting some small branches off of a couple of trees. I reached out to sun joe who seemed supportive at first. Maybe because it was still eligible for return. They assured me if I registered the product they would send me a new blade. Did as they ask and followed up. Never heard from them again. Cheap product and horrible customer service. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two uses.
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice and the chain kept falling off, even after multiple adjustments. The chainsaw finally stopped working after only two uses to trim/cut 2” thick branches from a tree. The chain no longer spins and a swirling noise can be heard coming from inside the chainsaw body.
customer_reviews.author: DETANE D.

customer_reviews.title: Apple Tree Pruning
customer_reviews.text: Works great for pruning our overgrown apple tree. Some of the reviews on here are crazy.. 1 star because someone fell off a ladder? Smoking? (Probably not oiled), chain falls off? (Make sure its tight before use). I've had no problems. I wasn't sure if it came with oil and found it does not, so you can pick up some at lowes or home depot for $5.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Utah

customer_reviews.title: Good Product & Value
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this pole chainsaw because we have a large tree that is near our solar panels, so branches and growth need to be trimmed on a regular basis so they don't block the sun. It is much easier to use, sturdier, better built and powerful than we expected! And the angle you choose stays locked in place. We feel that this is a good value and a good product. Even though we had never heard of Sun Joe products, we would now not hesitate to buy this brand of equipment again.
customer_reviews.author: heinz

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one last year and it has been reliable. It uses standard chainsaw oil that you can buy at any hardware store. The only got-ya is that the chain can be put on backwards. The clue that you did this is that it doesn't want to cut. Before you laugh, when you take a close look at the chain, to most people, the cutting edge is not obvious. Also, you'll want to store it level. Mine slowly leaked the the oil while standing and made a mess. I included a video with this review.
customer_reviews.author: John Stilwell

customer_reviews.title: Standard pole saw works better.
customer_reviews.text: Underwhelmed. The chain has too-few teeth to do a decent job of cutting, and it dulls super-quick. To make it worse, the tensioning bolt to keep the chain snug keeps slipping ... meaning you're stopping every couple of minutes to put the chain back on the track. In the end I can cut quicker with a standard pole saw. I'll probably end up selling this in a yard sale; that's it's ultimate value...
customer_reviews.author: Bamboo Dan

customer_reviews.title: Chain jumps
customer_reviews.text: I can't get the chain to stay in the groove. It continually must be set into the groove. Usually I can cut 4 branches before the chain jumps. I think the block isn't high enough to hold the guide in place.
customer_reviews.author: Thawker

customer_reviews.title: I Would Recommend! No Internal-combustion Motor to Maintain!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tohandle the branches that are too large for my manual pruner. It works and well! I would recommend one of these for anyone who has trees that require pruning. Yes, I did pick-up one of the larger units so it is a bit heavy but well worth the balancing, just use a lower limb if need be! Don’t know about longevity yet. Went with the corded to reduce weight, maintenance and I don’t need another combustion motor to keep-up! For as often as it is used, I will use a cord happily!
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for basic pruning
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value product. My only complaint is that I ordered a purple and got a grey. I bought it to prune trees that had some bigger branches that I could not reach or use a manual pole saw. Keep in mind, this is electric, it's not going to be as versatile or powerful as a gas one. My family and I trimmed several trees in one day and never needed to tighten the chain. Others mention oil leaking. That is very common with just about any chainsaw. I'm guessing those reviewers never owned a chainsaw before.
customer_reviews.author: Prvbswmn

customer_reviews.title: If you've never used a power saw don't start with this one!
customer_reviews.text: I carefully reviewed the product watched the videos and bought in good faith. It looked manageable for a new user. It is not. It's difficult to manage and therefor unsafe. It requires strength, because it is not counter balanced. The video is very misleading. It is a quality produce for an experienced user
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Good saw - except for the tensioner screw
customer_reviews.text: The tensioner screw fell out the third time I used the saw. As far as I can tell there's no retention mechanism of any kind, so be prepared to buy or improvise a replacement. Otherwise the saw works very well. It's a good but, but when the screw falls out you're dead in the water. Bad design. Hopefully the maker can provide a redesigned part with a retention mechanism (just a simple c-clip would do the trick)
customer_reviews.author: Peter S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed, it cut through 5 inch limbs with no effort while standing on the ground. It made short work of my 40 foot Asian Pear tree. The only thing I would have liked is a longer handle and a better tensioner system, but I'm not going to subtract points when it worked so well.
customer_reviews.author: zarxs

customer_reviews.title: Customer service rep advised item is known to catch fire.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Sunjoe. First one stopped working and was replaced. The replacement suddenly stopped working after 3-4 uses. Contacted sunjoe customer support - after holding for 12 minutes I was advised by rep that there have been numerous reports of the item catching fire and we needed to buy a different kind of extension cord! Seriously? I’m not comfortable using something that can catch on fire...why are they selling a product with a known dangerous defect? Will be returning it!
customer_reviews.author: coruna

customer_reviews.title: We got this on April 12th and it is now needing a new sprocket on April 29th.
customer_reviews.text: The sprocket is worn down and we have to replace it already. It's what makes the chain rotate. We are told in the owners manuel that if you replace the sprocket to also replace the chain. Already??? wtheck! We truly liked it just fine so far until we see it's already needing replacement parts. Disappointed. We don't want to return it but we shouldn't have to pay out for parts in 3 weeks! UPDATE: We have decided to keep it and fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Sunni

customer_reviews.title: We give this product a 10-star rating!
customer_reviews.text: Every time my husband uses this pole chain saw, he gives it rave reviews. It does a great job of sawing off branches up to about 8” thick. Even I, his not so strong wife, can handle it easily. Hubby purchased an electric chain saw around the same time, but hasn’t even used it yet. This Sun Joe saw is lightweight, easy to carry up a ladder and extends to reach those really high branches. We definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: ConeyIslandMN

customer_reviews.title: Fast becoming a favorite tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is no toy! The blade is sharp and the motor is powerful. When you press the switch, The torque comes on right now! I actually prefer using this over my 20" gas saw. Biggest problem is getting rid of all the limbs I cut. I love how this little guy makes short work of just about anything you can reach. I've had no issues putting it together, with the chain, or anything else. Just keep it full of bar oil ( the tank is small and runs through oil pretty fast) and cut what you can reach. Very good power. I've been cutting oak and dogwood mostly. Really happy with it especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: P. Theo

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It can get a bit heavy if you are using it horizontally. I used it to shape a tree in my yard. I'm no slouch but topping a tree on an 8' ladder fully extend length and it gets a little heavy. Trimming the sides of the trees vertically was no problem. On my first use the chain came off. I felt the instructions are were a little vague. I thought the chain was tight because there was no slack or sag. When I put the chain back on I tightened it a little tighter. I've had no trouble since.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Defective, Misleading Size
customer_reviews.text: The last step for assembling the chainsaw was to test the multi-angle head. I'm sure glad I did, because it was loose and defective to the point it could not be tightened properly. If I had used it, it could have caused serious injury. Also, in the about section for the product it reads: "TELESCOPING: Pole extends from 5. 8 ft. To 8. 8 ft. for up to 14 ft. overhead reach" which is somewhat misleading. I didn't realize this was assuming I was 5'4" tall and I thought the actual product length is 14-feet -- it most definitely isn't. I shipped this back and ordered a product from Harbor Freight instead with a fixed neck.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little saw!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today and put it right to work. It was exactly what I was looking for! Great little chainsaw for the price too. Easy extends and locks solid into place. It swivels a decent amount making it easy to cut limbs from the top. I’m pleasantly surprised at the quality and power of the saw. Very happy with my purchase. My only criticism would be that when I added chain oil into the reservoir it didn’t flow easily down into it and ended up overflowing everywhere. Not sure why it does that... but if that’s the only issue this thing has then I’ll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I have used this saw to take down a number of small trees and some good sized limbs. No issues! This saw has good power but is it not a replacement for a “real” chainsaw (I found this out on a large tree limb. ) If you use it for what it is intended to do, it will be fine. You do need to make sure there’s oil in it before and during operation, as it seems to go through it fairly quickly. Use good bar oil, not the stuff that comes with it and make sure to follow the instructions well!
customer_reviews.author: JVII

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad At All
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with my pole saw. I prefer a regular chainsaw, but this made trimming my trees a lot easier. Once the chain is adjusted I put in som 40w oil and started sawing away for about 2 hours. I was trimming high, low and in between. It is not something that a weaker individual would like to use. It does take balance and some strength to operate it especially overhead, but it does the job and for the price I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hill

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly powerful and effective.  i wont be going back to gas
customer_reviews.text: this is way better than my gas pole saw. the chain spins slower than a gas saw, but the electric saw has a ton of torque, it cuts right through branches faster than my gas pole saw. cuts through branches even up to 8in in diameter with ease. unlike the gas however, this one starts instantly and none of the common 2 stroke starting and running issues common with small gas pole saws. and for the fraction of the price of a quality gas saw!! only issue the the flex joint does not get tight, bolt jut rotates in place. i think i can fix this however by using different hardware.
customer_reviews.author: EZ-Innovations

customer_reviews.title: Chain jumps, broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: Nothing super special about this device. It's a pole chain saw, maybe a bit underpowered, but it worked for a month or two. Then the mechanism that adjusts chain tension started to go and the chain started jumping. It was annoying to put the chain back on during every use, but I managed. Today the screw that adjusted tension came completely out and is somewhere in the brush next to my garage. It's a specialty part that I can't replace, so I'm going to end up replacing the entire unit with a different model/brand.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: It actually works better than I expected. I've cut a lot of wood with it. My only complaint is the oiler makes a big mess and continues to run out when the saw is not in use. I've yet to use the angle feature on any of my trees. No need to purchase a different chain as some have suggested. I have a gas chainsaw also but this is great for limbing and small trees and other small jobs. Much lighter and easier to use than the heavy gas saw.
customer_reviews.author: flyflotr

customer_reviews.title: Loving my pole saw!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little saw!!!!! Even with all my health issues and back problems I can manage to use this saw! Its light weight and powerful. Zips right through a tree limb in no time! Easy to assemble and use. I think this thing would cut thru a log if I was patient and gave it some cool down time. Excellent product. Just keep eye on oil level and make sure the bolt stays tight while using it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great, But A Couple Precautions
customer_reviews.text: I trimmed 4 large trees with this pole saw and I have been very happy with it’s performance. It cuts through the branches like butter. 2 major cautions that I wanted to share: 1) Always check the chain for tightness after cutting around 4 branches. It’s easy to do with the supplied wrench/screwdriver. The new chain stretches and will jump off the motor. 2) Check the oil level frequently. It uses quite a bit of oil to lubricate the chain. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Surprising Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was very concerned as to the quality of this saw. I have never liked electric chain saws. This little saw is a dream to use paid for itself within 4 hours use. Remember the new chain will need adjusted regularly and check oil often. Using a HEAVY extension cord of 100ft. I was able to add a medium weight cord and get 200ft. with good performance. Just let the saw do the work and do not bear down on it. Do not be afraid to purchase this saw. It is not my chain saw ,but I cant reach what this saw is able to reach. Excellent investment. Did a lot from a good 8ft step ladder and extension ladder.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a real chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This is Meh at best. i mean it functions, but you're not cutting down any thick branches with it. its great from removing some small tree limbs. however, my biggest complaint. The oil. Make sure you drain the oil after each use. I used this one time. left the oil in it. the next day its all over the equipment pole, the foam handle, my garage floor. to be fair its in the instructions but I mean who would have thought it would completely fall out of the machine. Needless to say I haven't used it since. Trying to get the oil out that foam handle is not something i'm interested in. I went and bough a chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jay6

customer_reviews.title: Great considering price point.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so yah the chain sometimes falls off especially if you jam it and it's a little peculiar to weild, especially at full length, so your going to jam it eventually, but reality check, at this price point it pays for itself in its first use if you would pay an arborist to do the job instead.. with that factored it's friggin awesome if it lasts a season. Just expect a workout when using it stretched out and a bit of easy tinkering to keep it working. Definitely want safety glasses, no, really... Wood chips will be raining down on you like a plague of locust.
customer_reviews.author: AlexCphoto

customer_reviews.title: Double Check Your Blade
customer_reviews.text: Tried one small two inch branch and this thing wouldn't even cut the bark. I thought I had followed all directions perfectly. The box that was zip tied to the pole had a warning to not remover zip ties until after assembly of blade. I did that. Turns out the chain was zip tied backwards on the bar. MAKE SURE YOU CHECK BLADE DIRECTION REGARDLESS OF ZIP TIES AND WARNINGS. Reinstalled chain and tried a second time. Cut through everything with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus Cowan

customer_reviews.title: I will not go" without my Sun joe" lol
customer_reviews.text: Seriously this thing works wonders it slices right through with ease...well...once i put the chain in correctly it did! 😂 thank so much I had weeds out there that looked like tries and me being a single mom and not knowing how to maintain my yard at all this is a life saver. I felt like yelling "timber"! When those big weed trees fell..my neighbor is always fixing up their lawn and backyard the husband is a contractor/ landscaper..i think they found new respect for me when i was finally able to slice down those monster weeds and prune my trees "like a boss" 😂 thanks again to the inventor!
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Grey

customer_reviews.title: happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this saw. It can be a little hard to handle at full extension, especially bringing it back down. It is top heavy but that is the nature of the saw. All the working parts are at the top. I read reviews about oil leakage. I have not had a problem in that area. I wonder if those people stored the saw blade down, using the handle to hang it. The oil goes to the blade/bar that is how it works. Store it blade up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It worked great a few times. The sprocket now slips and the chain is unable to cut. I would not buy this because it is cheap and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: TRickman

customer_reviews.title: VERY DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: This product fell apart after 10 minutes The plastic broke immediately and the blade flipped off. I am going to write to the company and let them know they have a very faulty product that could have hurt me considerably
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Surprising little saw!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t expecting much for the price but was pleasantly surprised; this by far exceeded all expectations, I used it all day to cut limbs and branches from my oak trees and it was amazing. It had plenary of power and barley used any oil. I have a $600 Stihl but will be using this for everything except the big jobs. Great little saw!!
customer_reviews.author: W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: No oil come out
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw in the end of 12/18 and got it in January 19. I put every parts together and added chain saw oil bought from Home Depot. I used it a few days ago. I cut 10-inch tree fine. However, I found no oil came out for saw. I checked the oil hole is not blocked. I think it must have something wrong with the automatic oil system. Does anyone have any suggestion for solving this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Anna Yang

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this model for the ability to angle the cut. Found I don't really need to adjust the angle. Oh well. Using the saw was very straight forward. Cut very nicely. I have a battery operated chain saw and this out cuts it two to one. Telescopes easily and stays locked in with no sliding. All proper precautions need to be used. I would highly recommend that you wear a hard hat when working directly over your head. Being careful I still had a couple of close calls with branches coming down not quite as expected.
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: Must have for homeowners
customer_reviews.text: I have several very large pine trees on my property with low hanging branches. Not only do I have to walk through them when mowing my lawn, but they drop sap and pine cones all over. The Sun Joe pole saw is a true blessing and a must have for any homeowner with trees on their property. Extended at full length, there is no kickback and the chain cuts quick and smooth. The only part that I am not too confident with is the clamp to lock it when extended. Not that I think it will give out, but that the plastic handle that you clamp down on seems like an easy breaking point.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT LEND IT OUT EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an animal. I just cut up a full tree that’s stump was over a foot thick and was 8” thick at 6-8’ Now that ugly tree is warming me....in my fireplace!!! Branches everywhere and hard access but she performed like a star ballet dancer. Just over an hour to cut tree!!! Ha! Amazing. It cut back my thick shrubs too! Bottom line,keep her clean, keep oil full, blades sharpened and no stupid moves, you will be blown away by the performance and ability of this saw. She will last too ! So far so good! Oh, yes, and one more thing. DONT LET ANYONE BORROW IT! That’s all I will say. MOST EXCELLENT SAW!👍
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Not Ready to Use
customer_reviews.text: This item does not come fully assembled with the most important part and whole reason you bought it being the part you yourself have to put together - the chain saw and bar end. Nor does it come with the required chain bar oil so after you do assemble it you still can't use it. I bought an electric version because I'm not familiar with chain saws and didn't want a larger gas powered tool for the light pruning work I have around my property. I thought a light battery or electric powered "ready to use" tool would be better. This tool was not what I bargained for.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tarantelli

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly good for the price - should hold up for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this based on the positive reviews, and the price. I've had a gas-powered pole trimmer for a while but got tired of the maintenance and starting problems that come with any rarely-used power equipment. The 8 amp power is surprisingly good. To be clear - this is NOT high-quality commercial equipment but it works surprisingly well for occasional trimming and can cut 6" limbs without issue. The oiler on mine doesn't seem to distribute nearly enough oil so we'll see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: HeLa

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm. Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw. Worth every penny. I needed to trim a few palms and small trees branches around my house so this chainsaw came to rescue. It trimmed down my palm's and trees branches within 30 minutes. It cut thru them like butter. My neighbor was observed and amazed at how fast this chainsaw was cutting. It looks simple, lightweight, yet, powerful. It's very easy to assemble and use. Just remember to check and refill oil if you have lot of cuts. Since I like it so much so I bought another Sunjoe 2-in-1 for my vacation home. Lol. As usual when working with power tools, you need to wear protective gear such as goggles, gloves... Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KIM E.

customer_reviews.title: Nicely balanced
customer_reviews.text: Balance is important with an electric, expanded, pole saw and this one has it. I've borrowed a buddy's several times and like it alot so I finally bought my own. He's had his for several years. The instructions make sure you install the chain the correct way and it's a quality enough chain I haven't had to adjust it since, even though it'll be easy to do. The foam grip is nice to absorb shock and is dense enough it'll last. I doubt I'd have to buy it again, but I WOULD recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: BeemerPilot

customer_reviews.title: Does small jobs well. It's not too heavy for small woman.
customer_reviews.text: My husband assembled. I'm not mechanically inclined. I do climb the ladder. Husband is afraid of heights. While I was on the ladder and stretching high overhead while wearing goggles, the saw got a bit heavy and awkward for my arms. If I wasn't stretching up so, it was easier, and on the ground it was a piece of cake. My husband can handle it with much more ease, just from the ground (lol). It is not made for huge limbs, but we did cut up to 4 inch diameter a couple of times. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dory

customer_reviews.title: Very happy... ordered a second one for a friend.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sunjoe pressure washer and it has worked great over the last 3 years. I needed a new pole saw and saw this one and felt comfortable purchasing it. The 8 amp motor is plenty of power. Obviously, you should not cut limbs overhead that will bind the saw before the branch is cut. It's light enough to easily carry up a ladder to prune branches above the house. As long as you don't misuse this saw and keep the blade sharp you should be quite happy with it. I don't see anything out there for the price that beats it. Shipping was fast for both saws ordered 3 days apart.
customer_reviews.author: RayRay

customer_reviews.title: The Little Engine That Could
customer_reviews.text: Been able to use this chain saw a couple of times. Worked very well both times. When extended, it is heavy if you are cutting limbs that are high off the ground. I was able to use a ladder and get the limbs that needed to be reached. I was able to fell a 12in tree. It took longer to cut than it would've with my 18in gas one, but the latter was not working that day. Still, this little chain saw performed very well. As usual, wear a hard hat and googles. Especially when cutting branches hanging high. Yes, I'd recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: P’atak

customer_reviews.title: Saved me $130.00
customer_reviews.text: May be the best 63 bucks I ever spent. Tree trimmers wanted $200 to do what I did in less than an hour. Walks through branches like soft butter when the chain is new. Don't know about how long the chain will stay sharp. If I wasn't 76 years old I'd go all around the neighborhood volunteering to trim everybody's trees, it's so much fun. All the adjustments on it are easy and intuitive. Hang it on the wall in the shed until I need it again. Pat myself on the back for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Works great!! I only gave it four stars because ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! I only gave it four stars because the directions for assembly could be a bit confusing and vague. I am pretty mechanically inclined and had a tough time with one of the elements. If you were a first timer or didn't know much about attaching saw blades you would be totally lost. This product needs a much better system of assembly instructions for sure!!! One you get it together it does work great! As usually be careful when using this on smaller trees with higher sap content - the blade tends to get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: It certainly makes trimming tree branches so much easier. Assembly was quick. Putting in chain oil was a little tricky with the fidgety cap/cord, but not a big deal. The chain is nice and sharp, and goes through the 4-6" diameter cherry branches quickly (20-30 seconds). It's electric, so not as convenient as a gas powered trimmer, but then again, you don't have to hassle with gas and getting it started after winter storage. Saw seems very well put together, but I've only used it to trim about 10 branches.
customer_reviews.author: WhatISaid

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Just got done using this for the first time...cut down an 8.5" or so size branch. ..didn't even phase this thing...used it to limb the smaller branches instead of my 14" chainsaw. ..no bending over to get that done, way safer as well. Oiler worked fine and i adjusted the chain after using it and worked like a charm. It is a tad on the heavy side but no more than i expected. Great item really...quality is impressive for the price. Used a 100' 12 ga extension cord to get enough current.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great saw. Keep losing the tension screw.
customer_reviews.text: The saw, overall is great. We used it heavily to prune our 3 massively over-grown mulberry trees. The maneuverability is great with the angled saw capability. It's fairly lightweight as well. Only complaint (and something I've seen on various other posts) is that the tension screw for the bar is known to come loose and fall out during use. I guess I need to take better notice and tighten it immediately after every use. At any rate, the part is easily ordered on their website.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I am old and no longer comfortable standing on a ladder, with no hands free, while I operate a chainsaw. I thought it would be useful for cutting only small limbs. I was so wrong. It cuts through 5" like butter. It is also much safer having that blade a good distance from my arteries. I just cannot say enough good things about this tool. One caution: The oil reserve is small and I needed to refill after about an hour of use.
customer_reviews.author: tberry

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bad product, when I first time used, chain slipped off and damege the head and chain.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Used it just once so far and it performed great. Make sure to get some chainsaw oil before you start using it. Using the full extension is pretty tough, it is hard to hold and maneuver. Luckily I did not need that this time. I would not count on using it at full extension unless you have a lot of upper body strength and good leverage from whatever position you are in - so not from a ladder. It worked for what I needed so that's great. I expect I will use it more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Sunjoe did an excellent job!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful. Great tool. I just used this tool almost exclusively to drop 7 full size trees. Starting from 50feet in the air on a basket lift, I used the extended pole of the SunJoe SWL803E to reach all branches and take down the trees and prune others near by with ease. Used 1 Blade! Kept well oiled. Cut fast with ease. Little arm pressure needed to cut. Cut up to 8 or 9 inch branches. Tool is well built. Heavier than expected but based on quality and great job done, I am good with it.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal J Mendala

customer_reviews.title: great for reaching branches without climbing a tree
customer_reviews.text: easy to use. Have used it 4 times so far. No problems whatsoever. I used a 30 ft extension cord hooked up to my 2KW Honda Generator. It gave me great mobility in accessing remote trees in my yard. It has paid for itself by not having to a tree service. Worth it. A bit of advice, keep an eye on the chain oil level as you use it and replenish as required, it does go through the oil at a fair rate. More so than a Stihl gas chain saw.Easy to fill though. Read the instruction manual !
customer_reviews.author: discerning customer

customer_reviews.title: Safety issue!!!!!!Will not stay tight on angles other than that seems good
customer_reviews.text: Would have gave it 5 stars but the whole reason I bought it was for the angles... Poorly made!!!!!!!! Will not stay tight....Cheap as u can get....Other than that I love it.. I'll just put a bolt and nut on it so it will stay tight. Need to go back to the drawing board on that.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: As aggravating to us as it is handy.
customer_reviews.text: As far as cutting and performing I would say this is a handy nice pole saw. I just don’t like the design of the bolt that holds the saw blade in place. After every 3-4 cuts you ha e to stop and tighten the blade in place or the blade and chain will fall off saw while in use. Knowing this error in design I never would have bought this. Plus you can only tighten by hand because it’s not designed to be tighten with a tool. “No bolt head”
customer_reviews.author: Wanda L. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: I really like this pole saw compared to my previous Remington
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pole saw compared to my previous Remington. My old Remington had broken oil pump lid and the extension coupling knob which failed on 2nd year even I used it only 2-3 times for trimming my trees during the spring season. For the past 10 yrs I was tired of manually applying oil on chain. I also drilled multiple holes on pole to hold the extension until I could not stand with it anymore. I don't know whether the new Remington model has improved but this Sun Joe beats every feature of my old Remington such as a quick tight lock extension, adjustable saw head downward...
customer_reviews.author: H. Dao

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Trimmed branches and was able to chop down a tree that had a hollow and split, leaving a large portion of the tree hanging on a swing in our yard. I'm actually really impressed with how easily this thing chewed through the larger sections of the tree, as well as how quickly it limbed the smaller sections!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tool, it cuts well and can be head heavy if reaching way up in a tree, but otherwise it did what I wanted. The chain had to be tightened during use but that's the nature of chain saw type tools. Except for initially overfilling the reservoir, no leaks were experienced from under the reservoir cap. This tool operated exactly as I hoped, and kept me from having another container of mixed oil and gas sitting in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tree trimming saw. Cuts through the branches like a hot knife through butter. I had a Remington pole saw but the wire inside the pole somehow broke probably from the twist motion to extend the pole. I like this much better than the Remington because the saw doesn’t detach. The Remington would always get unplugged at the end of the pole where the saw disconnects so I’d need to take it down several times to plug it in again, even though I taped it together. Also like the lever to make the pole longer, again much better than the Remington. 8 amp is the way to go. Lots of power.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Powerful saw
customer_reviews.text: A much more powerful tool than I thought it would be. I had a 15-20 ft tree come down in a windstorm. Cut through 14 inch trunk like soft butter. Cut it all into manageable 10 to 12 inch chunks. Only grumble is that the locking mechanisim does not lock very well when you are working overhead. It keeps slipping. Cheap plastic latch does not lock properly. In this case I mostly used it in the reclined position so not a big issue. When using as a pruning tool as it is I think designed for this is an issue. Powerfull saw though. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: CJL

customer_reviews.title: Completely Useless
customer_reviews.text: I only write reviews when something's amazing or absolutely worthless. This pole saw once correctly assembled wouldn't even cut through a small 1/2" branch let a long something more substantial like a 3" branch. This version didn't come with the specified tool (hex-wrench) either, I think I got a different version w/ a screw-off nut. Either way, it was like trying to cut a well-done steak w/ a spoon. The saw seemed to function properly and was stable but ZERO cutting ability. Huge pain considering assembly, filling w/ bar oil (at an add'l cost) and dealing w/ 100's of feet of extension cord. Worthless if you ask me,
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K.

customer_reviews.title: Most disappointing Amazon purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was disappointing with both the product and the window for returning the product. By the time I was able to actually get out in dry weather and cut through 2 4" limbs of a cedar tree in an hour and find out how frustrating this would be for anything other than small branches, the Amazon return window was closed. Lesson learned. Buy a real chainsaw and make these purchases local instead of through the mail.
customer_reviews.author: GregSchro

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe SWJ803E 10" inch 8.0 Amp Electric Multi-Angle Pole Chain Saw, Green
customer_reviews.text: I am reviewing the Sun Joe SWJ803E 10" pole saw. Got it about 1 month ago, for $59.99 here on Amazon. So far it's done great, easily cutting the size limbs/trees as per the description. The chain does loosen over usage time, which is normal for a chainsaw, so pay attention to keeping that tight and oiled as directed. We got our money back on the first day of use. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tomp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pruning and limbing saw cuts fast.
customer_reviews.text: Great right out of the box. Just pay attention to the installation instructions getting the chain put on as instructed and use bar oil. Great use for climbing having cut put to 6 inch branches so far. Motor handled the work load without overheating or bogging down. The only thing that would make it better is to have a larger opening for the bar oil. Bar oil is thick so it is difficult to keep from spilling oil when filling especially in the cold. I would not have expected to be as durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great price and seems sturdy enough for my once or twice a year use. I trimmed a neighbors tree in my yard and a few palm trees; it cut like butter. I hate cords but knew it would be occasional use and I did not want to get into the battery powered tools that you would have to buy an expensive battery replacement at some point. I also could not justify getting a gas saw. I’m hoping it holds up awhile with my minimal use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, quite amazing
customer_reviews.text: The pole chain saw works very powerfully and quickly, I was impressed. The chain tension has to be adjusted a few times until the chain stretches, but after that is just fine. The oiling system works very well, chain stays lubricated for extended periods. Examples of saw in use by other reviewers on YouTube.com are worth watching and completely as I found the saw. The ability to change length of the pole in a few seconds was quite helpful and stable once done. For light weight trimming of limbs and overgrown hedges, this is a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Arteriole

customer_reviews.title: This works great, very capable tool
customer_reviews.text: This went together very quickly and was very easy to use... Be sure to use the little wrench to tighten the side cover ( you need to pop off the green cap and underneath is a nut which tightens ). I had a quite large branch which had 1/2 fallen, using this saw I was able to safely remove the smaller branches and even cut up most of the larger branch itself. This worked better than I had expected or hoped and I would not hesitate to recommend this tool, or to purchase other items from same manufacturer. 100% satisfied
customer_reviews.author: W. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Kicks well past it's coverage
customer_reviews.text: i miss football so i had to throw in an analogy for everyone else in withdrawals. I bought this thinking it would be a throwaway after one use, but since i've found myself with lots of time on my hands recently, i had a chance to use it a lot more than i expected. It's a great little machine with lots of power to get through almost anything. highly recommend it, can't image you would find a better machine for less.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hines

customer_reviews.title: A high value tool. Be advised this is not a simple pole saw but a chainsaw. Use caution.
customer_reviews.text: This saw was a breeze to assemble.Using this saw is problematic simply by virtue of the physics involved ... think about it, a significant mass mounted to the end of a pole,Operating an electric chainsaw @ the end of a pole is Not a walk in the park & of course I broke all the rules. Up & down an extension ladder cutting nearly directly overhead & I didn't need to worry about the saw once. MAINTAIN THE BAR OIL! the very small capacity tank empties fast. The flip lever clamp allows for very quick, secure, length adjustments on the fly w/o interrupting the job.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: no problem
customer_reviews.text: just look at the pics. the big chunk is about 12" and the other two are about 10" thick wet oak. these 3 pieces weight about 200lbs a piece. make sure the chain seems overly tight when assembling because when they warm up, they get a bit looser. just wish it was a bit longer but then it would probably harder to control. way better than the battery one i had that someone stole out of my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Gangross

customer_reviews.title: Quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the low price you really cannot beat this saw, it is much cheaper than the battery powered versions and without the hassle of gas/oil/noise. Great for trimming trees in preparation for storms/yard maintenance. The cord is something you have to deal with but given branches don't grow overnight you won't be using it every week anyways so definitely worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Luceras

customer_reviews.title: Bad design flaws!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about 30 minutes, then the design flaws started showing. The entire chassis is made of cheap plastic, so when you tighten up the side plate after putting the chain on, you'll see that it's only held in place by a little nub of plastic. Well, with the vibration, that doesn't last long, and after an hour, I had to use zip ties because it kept popping off, and taking the entire chain with it. Waste of time!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: The casing that holds the blade cracked -purchased in Nov 2018- just started using it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because it was lower priced than the big chain Hardware stores. Worked like a charm for about 4x' using it , but the casing that holds the saw to pole cracked during a job - the blade came down quick cutting my husband' right thumb pretty badly. We are now on the way to Emergency room. So sad didn't expect the casing to crack the blade right off pole-Just cutting the low lying maple LIMBs that surround the house to not big trees . The trunk no bigger than 9 inches in diameter but limb was hanging low onto gutter. Wish we got Protection Agreement - Maybe Sun Joe can help us out.
customer_reviews.author: maria sorrentino

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and good value
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing more than a small electric chain saw on a pole. But it is a very good small electric chain saw. It is a high torque low RPM type saw and goes through hardwood branches very very fast. Handling a saw on the end of a pole is awkward, especially given that most of the weight is on the end, so don't expect the control and results you would get with being up there on a ladder. But not having to be up there on a ladder is the whole point of this saw and it works well doing what it is designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Haans

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because description sounded ideal and most reviews were positive. However when we actually started to use it yesterday, it is a huge disappointment. Already had to sharpen the blade, the pole/handle slips up and down despite numerous tightening, and the chain comes of easily and doesn't tighten easily. Spend a bit more and buy from Harbor Freight. Sun Joe is junk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Packs a Punch
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well engineered product. ( I am and engineer with MSME and 40 years design experience). I was able to cut down 4 trees in my yard. 3 medium sized trees and one large tree close to the house. The tree service wanted $10,000 to do the job. I was able to do it in 2 days with this saw, ladder and a larger electric saw of the same make. I bought new blades for each tree and watched some videos on tree cutting safety on You Tube.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Metz

customer_reviews.title: Chain Falls off every time I use it
customer_reviews.text: Chain Falls off every time I use it. I saw other reviews that said chain fell off but there were so many great reviews so I over looked it. WARNING do not buy. I tried to contact Sun Joe but couldn't get a real person on the phone. If the manufacture is reading this please contact me about the product to return or provide a working saw.
customer_reviews.author: Zachsry collins

customer_reviews.title: Went through 4" applewood like butter!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this yesterday. Amazing! Tried it on a dead apple tree. I wen through 4 -5" branches like they were butter. First impression is excellent. Two comments : 1) The chain oil tank is very small. Keep a careful eye on it. No need to burn up chains. 2) For some reason, the price is very color dependent, with the grey one costing $80, but the purple $60. The saws are identical, except for the color. Needless to say, I have a pretty purple chainsaw!
customer_reviews.author: weld-it-all

customer_reviews.title: Really helped after a wind storm.
customer_reviews.text: After having this for a few months sitting in my shed, I used it to take down some tree branches that had cracked during a recent wind storm in my area. This made it easy to cut them down and only take out the ones that I needed to without harming the other branches. The adjustable angle head was great for getting additional leverage on bigger branches. When the pole is fully extended and used for a long time, it can feel heavy, so only extend it when needed. The manual recommends to use a 14 gauge extension cord with this model.
customer_reviews.author: heretohelp

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little saw, but about half of the reach as stated when fully extended
customer_reviews.text: Pretty lightweight and not too top heavy. Assembly was straightforward. They must have let a fisherman estimate the overall reach though, because you would have to be 10 feet tall already to get the reach as advertised. It’s really closer to 8-9 feet from the ground. And it doesn’t sit flat for easy filling of the bar and chain oil reservoir. So be prepared to have to hold it level while you fill it...and to make a mess. Operationally, it worked smoothly and made quick work of the tree limbs I could reach with it.
customer_reviews.author: C Fritsche

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I am so sorry that I waisted my money on this one. I hate writing bad reviews. I could only use this product to cut 1 branch the size of a big crayon at a time. The screw keeps coming loose and I have to keep re- tightening it. It took me 1/2 hour to cut 4 branches. Not only that but the oil leaks out and makes a mess. I should have just returned it and gotten on with my life. Live and learn !
customer_reviews.author: yours truly

customer_reviews.title: Operation was easy with extendable reach
customer_reviews.text: A couple of trees around the house need pruning and trimming, I got an estimate for $125. The frugal side took over and I purchased this product. Wow, it came mostly assembled and with every thing needed for action, the oil and the goggle. An hour later, the job is done. I've just paid myself $125. Operation was easy with extendable reach. The unit was strong and sharp and agile. It can cut 4" tree branches like butter while maneuvering in tight space. Pruning it one time and it's already worth my dough. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LanPham

customer_reviews.title: No more worries when the wind blows
customer_reviews.text: If you’re use to using saw then this will be a piece of cake. If you’re new to using a saw, don’t get discouraged. Putting this together is simple and pretty much straightforward. As long as you line up the chain and tighten correctly, you’ll have no issues. The saw cuts with ease, I had no issues cutting multiple tree limbs of all sizes for multiple hours. Chain never popped once.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. RogersTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: do not trip
customer_reviews.text: I returned the item because it did not work. I called a technician who was grossly lazy and unwilling to help so I told him he can get it back. The pole saw also arrived with slight damage at the foam handle and there was no information or instruction send with it. Very disappointing. However, as soon as I send the item back I ordered a other one and I am very happy with it. I must make a complaint however, regarding the absolute disinterest of your technician.
customer_reviews.author: garr

product_meta.title: Sun Joe SWJ803E-CMO 10 inch 8.0 Amp Electric Multi-Angle Pole Chain Saw, Camo
product_meta.description: Color:CamoSAW WHAT YOU SEE! Tackle those hard-to-reach branches with ease. The Sun Joe SWJ803E electric pole chain saw takes the danger and difficulty out of trimming your overgrown trees. Stand safely on solid ground and simply adjust SWJ803E’s telescoping pole to gain up to 14 feet of overhead reach. Powered by a robust 8-amp motor, the SWJ803E’s multi-angle head can handle the most stubborn tree limbs up to 9.5-inches thick. It features a durable, 10-inch Oregon bar and chain with an auto-oiler to keep the bar and chain fully lubricated during use. Unlike gas-powered tools, SWJ803E is powered electrically, so you’ll reliably power up with the push of a button without having to deal with smoke, fumes, unpredictable starters or costly tune-ups. Plus the SWJ803E comes equipped with a built-in safety switch to prevent accidental starting. The Sun Joe SWJ803E electric pole chain saw carries a full two-year warranty.
feature_bullets: VERSATILE: Ideal for cutting overhanging limbs and thin logs
TELESCOPING: Pole extends from 5. 8 ft. To 8. 8 ft. for up to 14 ft. overhead reach
POWERFUL: 8-amp motor cuts branches up to 9. 5-Inches thick

WE’VE GOT YOU COVERED! : Your new pole chainsaw is backed by the Snow Joe + Sun Joe customer promise. We will warrant new products for two years from the date of purchase. NO QUESTIONS ASKED. Contact Snow Joe + Sun Joe Customer Support at 1-866-766-9563 for further assistance

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,778 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
